page.title: 06HEDGEROWS
page.content: The area is criss-crossed by mile upon mile of typical{Cornish hedgerow, lining the lanes and dividing up the fields. Most are over{3m high}and{1m {wide,}containing a{stone}centre with layers of{turf}placed on top. Over the years these old hedgerows have become fully vegetated. Strong plants which can stand the wind grow on top, especially the{hazel.} A host of{wild flowers}are found at lower levels. We saw 20 different plants in a short 50m section of hedgerow at Nineoaks:-{red hempnettle, {great bindweed, meadow vetching, {meadow buttercup, leafy hawkweed, {valerian, bluebells, red campions, {black knapweed, tufted vetch, hedge {bedstraw, yarrow, hogweed, dock, broad {leaved willow-herb, germander {speedwell, chickweed, herb robert, {greater stitchwort}and{bracken.
